intro: Melolobium brachycarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited melolobium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its legume-like pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. Its fruit is a narrow, elongated pod that contains several seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
